thread.title: 15 Mess-Free Parenting Hacks That You'll Be Forever Grateful For
thread.title_full: 15 Mess-Free Parenting Hacks That You'll Be Forever Grateful For

author: Krista Torres
title: 15 Mess-Free Parenting Hacks That You'll Be Forever Grateful For
text:
BuzzFeed ID: 10320631 1. Serve burritos to your kid in a mason jar to keep it from falling apart. View this image ›
paula1886 / Via instagram.com ID: 10308055 2. You can also keep the contents from spilling out of a burrito by sealing it with a chip clip. View this image ›
9gag.com ID: 10308631 3. Place Press’n Seal wrap over your kid’s shirt before they make a messy craft so their clothes don’t get dirty. View this image ›
raddestmom.com Via Raddest Mom .
ID: 10308658 4. Use an empty egg carton to make your kid’s painting sessions a whole lot less messy. View this image ›
momdot.com Via Mom Dot.
ID: 10308577 5. Use a spill-proof mason jar to prevent messes at snack time. View this image ›
babble.com Learn how to make one at Babble .
ID: 10308250 6. Put your kid’s outfits for each day in plastic bags when you go on vacation so you don’t have to dig through the suitcase. View this image ›
pinlady91 / Via instagram.com ID: 10308106 7. Tape your kid’s bubble wand to a pole or wall for a spill-proof bubble station. View this image ›
padburyfamilydaycare.com ID: 10314619 8. Hot glue the holes in the bottom of bath toys so mold doesn’t form. View this image ›
welovebeingmoms.blogspot.com ID: 10309174 9. Place freezie pops upright in your freezer before freezing for a mess-free cut. View this image ›
budget101.com ID: 10308582 10. Use a tackle box to keep your kid’s snacks organized on a road trip. View this image ›
lvmbcindy / Via instagram.com ID: 10308131 11. Stick eggs in a whisk before you color them so your kid’s fingers won’t get stained. View this image ›
mrshappyhomemaker.com Via Mrs. Happy Homemaker.
ID: 10308569 12. Store Legos bricks in hanging shoe organizers. View this image ›
ebay.com Via kidsactivitiesblog .
ID: 10315270 13. Use a shower rod to hang plastic baskets for an organized tub. View this image ›
Redditor Teruterus / Via lifehacker.com ID: 10308638 14. Keep baby bottle supplies organized with plastic storage containers. View this image ›
onecrazyhouse.com Via One Crazy House .
ID: 10309211 15. Use a carabiner to neatly store ponytail ties so they don’t get scattered everywhere. View this image ›
dreamingindiy.com Via Dreaming in DIY .
ID: 10309224
